caption.title: Catalogue of bones and bone fragments composing the partial skeleton of Miopetaurista neogrivensis.
caption.p: This list includes the catalogue numbers (preceded by the acronym ‘IPS’) of the various bones and bone fragments belonging to the partial skeleton of a single individual of Miopetaurista neogrivensis (IPS56468) from locality ACM/C5-D1. IPS, acronym for the collections of the Institut Català de Paleontologia Miquel Crusafont.

tr.td: distal half of the left tibia
distal half of the right radius, with damaged epiphysis
almost complete cranium, laterally compressed in an oblique angle
partial right mandible (angular process broken), caudal vertebra (probably corresponding to the mid part of the tail)
partial left mandible (articular process broken, all other processes with minor damage)
partial right coxal (proximal end of the ilium and part of the pubis damaged)
partial left coxal (missing most of the pubis and ischium, extensive damage in the ilium)
partial axis (only part of the vertebral body is preserved) and partial cervical vertebra (C3)
four caudal vertebrae (mid part of the tail) that articulate with one another
three partial thoracic vertebrae (T2–T4?) that articulate with one another
associated bone fragments (may not belong to M. neogrivensis)
associated bone fragments (may not belong to M. neogrivensis)
six distal phalanges which are not assigned to any particular ray or side; attribution to the foot is tentative
two sternebrae that articulate with one another
right clavicle (with minor damage in its acromial end) and partial left clavicle (acromial end missing)
complete right metatarsal 3, and partial rigth metatarsals 4 (proximal end missing), 2 and 4 (only distal half preserved)
four proximal phalanges and one partial proximal phalanx (distal half); they are not assigned to any particular ray or side
seven intermediate phalanges and five fragments; they are not assigned to any particular ray or side and attribution to the foot is tentative
four proximal phalanges; they are not assigned to any particular ray or side
right scapholunate and dorsal end of the right pisiform
